p: Among the chemical constituents of medicinal plants, flavonoids and other phenolic compounds are some of the most important, particularly due to their potential against oxidative stress [ 14, 15]. These phytochemicals are reported for their antimicrobial potential [ 16] and anticancer potential; indeed, moremore than 51% of anticancer drugs have been derived from natural sources [ 17]. Among all the natural compounds, flavonoids and phenolic compounds extracted from various plant species are reported for their cytotoxic potential against several cell lines [ 18, 19, 20].
